rtega_mnemonic:
蹤蹤RS
踪踪		footprints, traces, tracks
  • the remains of persons following each other 從 with their feet ⻊
  • tracks of numerous feet ⻊ near a house of worship 宗
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 踪)
Pictophonetic: 從 indicates the sound; 足 (foot) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
蹤影 [ zōng yǐng ]: trace; vestige; presence
蹤跡 [ zōng jì ]: tracks; trail; footprint; trace; vestige

heisig_chinese_memo: In the pirate(=wooden leg) religion, footprint tracks are important to follow because they lead to treasure.
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: In the pirate(=leg) religion, footprint tracks are important because they lead to treasure.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " foot ", " from " sound. The original meaning is footprint. "Release name. "Shi Yanyu": "Track, from the same, from the human form." "Jade chapter. "Foot": "Trace, trace also." Such as "Historical Records. "Xiao Xiangguo Family": "The husband hunts, the dog who chases the animal and the rabbit; and the one who shows the animal and the place is also the person." Liu Zongyuan of the Tang Dynasty "Jiang Xue": "Thousands of mountains and birds flew extinct, and thousands of people disappeared."

" Tracking " means to follow and follow. Such as "Historical Records. Biography of King Mengchang: "Wang Wang was shocked, and the traces of the king were inquired, Mengchang Jun had no countermeasures, and he called Mengchang Jun again." "Sui Shu. "The Biography of the Emperor Xiao Empress": "The quality is meager and difficult to trace, and the heart is happy and confused."

" Track " also means deeds and traces. Such as "Selected Works. Lu Shiheng "Xie Pingyuan Nei Shi Biao": "A piece of writing, regardless of the time, the handwriting of events, can be pushed to school, and once turned over, it is even more sinful." "Book of the Later Han. Sun Ci Biography: "Your Majesty disregards the diligence of the second ancestor and pursues the beauty of the five sects. He wants to look for peace. He wants to be straightforward, but he does it and seeks the predecessors."
humanum_short_description_en: From " foot ", " from " sound. The original meaning is footprint.
humanum_full_description:
從「足」，「從」聲。本義是足跡。《釋名．釋言語》：「蹤，從也，人形從之也。」《玉篇．足部》：「蹤，蹤跡也。」如《史記．蕭相國世家》：「夫獵，追殺獸兔者狗也；而發蹤指示獸處者人也。」唐代柳宗元〈江雪〉：「千山鳥飛絕，萬徑人蹤滅。」

　　「蹤」引申表示追隨、跟蹤。如《史記．孟嘗君列傳》：「湣王乃驚，而蹤跡驗問，孟嘗君果無反謀，乃復召孟嘗君。」《隋書．煬帝蕭皇后傳》：「質菲薄而難蹤，心恬愉而去惑。」

　　「蹤」還表示事跡、痕跡。如《文選．陸士衡〈謝平原內史表〉》：「片言隻字，不關其間，事蹤筆跡，皆可推校，而一朝翻然，更以為罪。」《後漢書．孫賜傳》：「陛下不顧二祖之勤止，追慕五宗之美蹤，而欲以望太平，是由曲表而欲直景，卻行而求及前人也。」

從「 足 」，「 從 」聲。本義是足跡。《釋名．釋言語》：「蹤，從也，人形從之也。」《玉篇．足部》：「蹤，蹤跡也。」如《史記．蕭相國世家》：「夫獵，追殺獸兔者狗也；而發蹤指示獸處者人也。」唐代柳宗元〈江雪〉：「千山鳥飛絕，萬徑人蹤滅。」 「 蹤 」引申表示追隨、跟蹤。如《史記．孟嘗君列傳》：「湣王乃驚，而蹤跡驗問，孟嘗君果無反謀，乃復召孟嘗君。」《隋書．煬帝蕭皇后傳》：「質菲薄而難蹤，心恬愉而去惑。」 「 蹤 」還表示事跡、痕跡。如《文選．陸士衡〈謝平原內史表〉》：「片言隻字，不關其間，事蹤筆跡，皆可推校，而一朝翻然，更以為罪。」《後漢書．孫賜傳》：「陛下不顧二祖之勤止，追慕五宗之美蹤，而欲以望太平，是由曲表而欲直景，卻行而求及前人也。」

Such as "Historical Records. "Xiao Xiangguo Family": "The husband hunts, the dog who chases the animal and the rabbit; and the one who shows the animal and the place is also the person." Liu Zongyuan of the Tang Dynasty "Jiang Xue": "Thousands of mountains and birds flew extinct, and thousands of people disappeared." " Tracking" means to follow and follow. Such as "Historical Records. Biography of King Mengchang: "Wang Wang was shocked, and the traces of the king were inquired, Mengchang Jun had no countermeasures, and he called Mengchang Jun again." "Sui Shu. "The Biography of the Emperor Xiao Empress": "The quality is meager and difficult to trace, and the heart is happy and confused." " Track" also means deeds and traces. Such as "Selected Works. Lu Shiheng "Xie Pingyuan Nei Shi Biao": "A piece of writing, regardless of the time, the handwriting of events, can be pushed to school, and once turned over, it is even more sinful." "Book of the Later Han. Sun Ci Biography: "Your Majesty disregards the diligence of the second ancestor and pursues the beauty of the five sects. He wants to look for peace. Liushutong characters (4)

蹤字的基本解释

蹤
zōng
同“踪”。

蹤字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zōng］
［《廣韻》即容切，平鍾，精。］
“從5”的今字。亦作“踪1”。亦作“踨1”。亦作“1”。
(1)脚印；踪迹。
(2)事迹。
(3)痕迹。
(4)追随；追踪。
(5)量词。幅、卷。专用于书画。
(6)用同“縱”。放纵。

蹤字的康熙字典解释

【酉集中】【足字部】　蹤； 康熙笔画：18； 页码：页1232第38
【廣韻】卽容切【集韻】【韻會】將容切，?音從。【玉篇】跡也。【釋名】從也。人形從之也。【前漢·揚雄傳】躡三皇之高蹤。○按《說文》無蹤字，古皆以縱爲蹤。詳糸部縱字註。　又【韻補】叶卽王切，音匡。【陸雲·陸府君誄】耽精遐奧，肆志篇章。仰咨遺訓，思齊曩蹤。

蹤字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
蹤字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［zōng］
["Guangyun" is Rongqi, Pingzhong, Jing. ]
The present character of "from 5". Also known as "Track 1". Also known as "踨1". Also known as "1".
(1) Footprints; traces.
(2) Deeds.
(3) Traces.
(4) Follow; follow.
(5) Quantifiers. Frames, rolls. Dedicated to calligraphy and painting.
(6) Use the same "vertical". indulgence.

[Guang Yun] 卽 Rong Qi [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] Will Rong Qi, the sound from. [Jade articles] Traces too. [Release name] Cong Ye. Human figures follow it. [Previous Han·Yang Xiong Biography] The High Traces of the Three Emperors. ○According to the word "Shuowen" without trace, the ancients always follow the vertical direction.
